breweries.name: Sea Dog Brewing Company
breweries.description: Today, Sea Dog Brewing Company operates brew pubs in two locations. The Sea Dog in Topsham occupies a scenic spot on the Androscoggin River. The Bangor location overlooks the historic Penobscot River. Both locations serve a full menu of handcrafted ales and creative pub fare with a flair. Being authentic is important to us. Our beers are brewed in a traditional style using only the highest quality ingredients like imported English two-row malted barley and British top-fermenting yeast. Our English brewing style results in brews with a distinctive, refreshing taste and crisp finish unique to top-fermented beers.

breweries.name: Great Lakes Brewing Company
breweries.description: In the 1870s, Cleveland had 30 breweries. By the early 1980s, the last one had shuttered its doors. So when brothers Patrick and Daniel Conway opened Great Lakes Brewing Company on September 6, 1988, it not only signaled a new era in Cleveland brewing, it was also the first microbrewery in the state of Ohio. And the idea of a craft brewery in Cleveland caught on fast, as curious patrons hurried in for a pint crafted in the styles of old and drawn from the taps of the beautiful Victorian era bar. The company's commitment to sustainable business practices greatly contributed to its early popularity and success. Before long, Great Lakes Brewing Company had become one of Cleveland's most popular destinations for both dining and a fun night out.

breweries.name: Cigar City Brewing
breweries.description: Cigar City Brewing was founded with two goals in mind. The first to make the world's best beer and the second to share with people near and far the fascinating culture and heritage of the Cigar City of Tampa. From its past as the world's largest cigar producer to its Latin roots and the many other diverse peoples that call it home, Tampa draws on many sources to develop its unique culture. At CCB we are fascinated by Tampa's history and suspect you will be too.

data.name: TroubleSome
data.description: Most brewers spend a lot of time and effort keeping lactobacillus out of their breweries; it was the first thing we brought in (it still has to stay in the corner though). We blend together two different beers to make Troublesome. The first is a somewhat uninteresting wheat beer and the second is an overly acidic & funky beer fermented solely with lactobacillus. We blend the two beers together with coriander and salt at the tail end of fermentation to create a mild, lemony tartness and a fuller sensation of mouthfeel. And yes, it's hard to make.

Midnight Brewery is Metro Richmond’s newest micro brewery, located in Rockville, VA (just west of the city). We are extremely creative with our work and brew several limited edition beers. So stop in frequently; you never know what will be on tap.

We are family owned and operated; we answer to ourselves and ourselves alone. Craft brewing the best beers possible is our passion. We brew beers that we love, and we know you’ll love them as well. We’re proud to continue the great tradition of locally brewed Richmond beers. Be sure to come to the brewery, or stop in one of the stores or restaurants that serve Midnight. And check out our events page; you never know where we’ll pop up around town. You won’t be sorry.

breweries.name: Round Guys Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Round Guys Brewing Company, located in Lansdale, PA, developed from the ghastly mind of chief Round Guy and head brewer, Scott Rudich. Looking for a quick exit out of the treacherous confines of the corporate world, Round Guys Brewing Company jumped onto the scene in late 2011, early 2012 and hasn't looked back. 

In 2013, Round Guys Brewing Company made waves by brewing up a now renowned BerlinerWeiss (Featured in Draft Magazine 10/13 and scored a 91. Featured on Brewers Network). In 2014, Round Guys Brewing Company received city wide recognition for placing a top 3 beer in the Philadelphia region's Beervitational during Philly Beer Week with Fear of a Brett Planet, a 100% Brettanomyces fermented Pale Ale. 

Other beers in its portfolio include Round Guys Brewing Company's goto Sundown Saison and the ever beloved Kiss Off IPA. 

The brewery features a full menu on site, including 1 specialty cask beer along side four seasonal, monthly, and rare offerings.

breweries.name: Wasatch Brewery
breweries.description: Wasatch Beers (Schirf Brewing Company) was formed when Greg Schirf found his way to Utah from Milwaukee,America’s beer capital, only todiscover that his newly adopted home state did not have a brewery of its own. Recognizing a need and an opportunity, he committed to rectify this situation. In 1986, Schirf opened the first brewery in the resort town of Park City and named his beers after the majestic Wasatch Mountains that rise just east of Salt Lake City. In July 1989, Schirf Brewing opened its new company headquarters and the first brew pub in Utah at the top of historic Main Street in Park City.

data.name: Water Street Wheat
data.description: Water Street Wheat Named after Decorah’s main street, this beer pays homage to our original accounts, most of whom reside on Water Street. Hints of bananas and cloves make this wheat beer a favorite. Easy drinking with tons of flavor, the velvet texture finish is reminiscent of the Upper Iowa River, which flows just down the street from the original brewery.

breweries.name: Toppling Goliath Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Toppling Goliath is a stealth brewery, flying fast, under the radar. This has been true since the day we quietly opened our first ½ barrel brewery and tap room on the west side of Decorah, IA in 2009. The batches were small but the taste was gigantic, and word spread like wildfire.

Today, our team brews at a larger production facility on the edge of town, regularly experimenting at the tap room to satisfy our craving for new and exciting creations. Numbers are not our game, making a lot of the same beer is just too boring, and life is just too short.

The history of Toppling Goliath lies in the dreams of tomorrow, not the pages of the past. The past is for those who rely on high volume and low value. The past is for those who duplicate rather than design. The past is for cowards. We are forward thinkers and cunning crafters, quietly building our revolution. “Big Beers Brewed in Small Batches.”

data.name: Water Street Wicked Wheat (Ws3)
data.description: Water Street Wicked Wheat (Ws3) “It’s Wicked Good!” as one of our original Mug Club Members would say in a Boston accent. This beer isn’t named for a street in Boston though; it’s Decorah’s main street wheat with a kick. Cascade and Amarillo hops give this wheat some extra flavor and aroma, where a blend of 4 different malts and a touch of wheat to give it the unique taste. Not your typical wheat, a hint of cloves will hit the back of your tongue as you savor the flavor.

beerVariation.description: Water Street Wheat Named after Decorah’s main street, this beer pays homage to our original accounts, most of whom reside on Water Street. Hints of bananas and cloves make this wheat beer a favorite. Easy drinking with tons of flavor, the velvet texture finish is reminiscent of the Upper Iowa River, which flows just down the street from the original brewery.

breweries.name: Toppling Goliath Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Toppling Goliath is a stealth brewery, flying fast, under the radar. This has been true since the day we quietly opened our first ½ barrel brewery and tap room on the west side of Decorah, IA in 2009. The batches were small but the taste was gigantic, and word spread like wildfire.

Today, our team brews at a larger production facility on the edge of town, regularly experimenting at the tap room to satisfy our craving for new and exciting creations. Numbers are not our game, making a lot of the same beer is just too boring, and life is just too short.

The history of Toppling Goliath lies in the dreams of tomorrow, not the pages of the past. The past is for those who rely on high volume and low value. The past is for those who duplicate rather than design. The past is for cowards. We are forward thinkers and cunning crafters, quietly building our revolution. “Big Beers Brewed in Small Batches.”

The idea for Black Acre initially was conceived in 2010 due to our love of brewing, great beer, and the beer community at large. We created Black Acre with the goal of contributing delicious and unique beers to the community in which we live.

Black Acre hand crafts its ales using a custom fabricated 3 barrel electric brewing system. The brewery will produce four house beers along with an ever rotating selection of seasonal and specialty beers. Distribution will be primarily though in house tap room sales although there will be limited outside distribution. Our beers are not ready quite yet, but stop by for a glass of one of our delicious guest taps and meet the staff.

breweries.name: Kauai Island Brewery & Grill
breweries.description:
Located in downtown Port Allen, “The Worlds Westernmost Brewery” and Kauai’s only brewpub, Kauai Island Brewery & Grill is open for business and eager to serve the Island of Kauai’s craft beer drinkers!

Kauai Island Brewing Company (KIBC) has its origins in Waimea Brewing Company, which had been located on the historic Waimea Plantations. When the lease was up, owners Bret and Janice Larson, along with their brewmaster Dave Curry and his wife Christina, decided to come together and become co-owners of their newly created Kauai Island Brewing Company, moving locations to Port Allen where they would have more space to brew the delicious beers they were known for. 

After eight months of renovation, Kauai Island Brewing Company has its home in the industrial building complex of Port Allen Center, with an industrial theme to go along with both its surroundings and purpose of crafting quality beers. Its 35-foot high corrugated metal ceilings and walls give it an open and spacious feel. The retro atmosphere with chandelier lights hanging from the ceiling, a catwalk leading to the second story mezzanine over the entrance, and picture perfect views of the sunset over Port Allen bay from the second story window makes it hard to say goodbye to this beautiful place.

We offer up to 10 of our own handcrafted in-house beers as well as several guest microbrewed beers, all on draft. If you can't stay for a pint, that's okay! We sell 64-ounce growlers that you can fill and take with you, as well as kegs available for customer pickup.

breweries.name: brewLAB
breweries.description:
brewLAB is Rob, Peter, Steve and the love of brewing beer. We are an artisinal nano-brewery in the city of Carpinteria, CA that focuses on creating small batch beers with an experimental approach. Rob and Steve met in 1999 and brewed their first batch of beer together in 2008. While attending UCSB, Rob met Peter while visiting Orella Ranch in Gaviota and they began brewing beer together in the Santa Barbara area. Then, in the summer of 2011, the three of them converged for a backpacking trip (pictured above) on The Lost Coast of Northern California - it was on this trip that they first discussed starting a brewery together. In late 2012 after some serious brainstorming and long meetings, the initiative had begun and planning was underway.
 
It is vitally important to us that we are directly involved with the production of our raw materials.  We are growing our own hops in the Santa Barbara area to supplement our usage, and in the future we plan to be growing enough to supply hops to the local community.  Our grains will be grown in the Santa Ynez Valley and malted right here in Santa Barbara.  All of our solid waste (spent grains, hops, yeast) will be fed to local pigs, local cricket farmers, or composted .  We will participate in, and contribute to, local festivals and events that revolve around brewing, environmentalism, and the promotion of local businesses.

data.name: Wheat Wacker
data.description:
The dog days are back.  No more snow, maybe a light rain here or there, but the time to exit the hibernating hovel is now.  Allergies be damned, it's time to break out those shades and soak in the sun.  Whether your idea of enjoying the longer days include gardening, lawn work, or just plain relaxing, we offer for you the Wheat Wacker, light in body but hoppy enough to know that this isn't any normal lawnmower beer.

On the west coast, we are partial to our hoppy beers, but love to experiment in the Belgian fashion.  By combining the sessionability of a witbier and the citrus qualities of Pacific Northwest hops, it gratifies on all fronts, including the warm fronts.  Is it a Belgian IPA, not really; a hoppy wit, maybe? Perfect for the summer, we think so.

Pilsner and wheat malt give the beer a light golden color with a subtle hint of clove and fresh cut grass.  Blending European noble and Pacific Northwest hops, the flavor is moderately spicy and citrusy.  Dry hopped like an IPA, fruity apricot notes intermingle with Belgian Yeast esters.

breweries.name: Pub Dog Pizza & Drafthouse
breweries.description:
Pub Dog Pizza & Drafthouse opened in 2001 on Cross St. in the historic neighborhood of Federal Hill in Baltimore.  It immediately became a hit with neighborhood residents, suburbanites, and tourists alike.

Pub Dog quickly became famous for our gourmet personal-sized thin-crust pizzas, fresh salads, and "Dog Deal" beers - 2 mugs of our own house craft beer for one low price all the time.  

We developed a loyal late night following by serving food every night until 1:30 and staying open until 2:00AM every night.

Pub Dog expanded outside of the city in 2007, opening a location in Columbia.

Pub Dog began bottling some of our house beers for sale to go in 2007.  The bottles are now available at both pubs and in liquor stores around the state.

data.name: White Sky
data.description: The sky was bright white on the chilly fall day that we first brewed our chai-spiced wheat beer. We’ve come a long way since then, but the gigantic clouds of white steam that billow from the towering blue steel mill at the end of town serve as a reminder of where it all began.
data.foodPairings: Sushi, tempura, and shellfish. Add garlic, lemon, shallots and butter for a great mussel broth.

data.name: Wide Open
data.description: From the great plains of open wheat fields, the fresh taste of Wide Open Wheat can’t be beat.  This wheat beer uses bavarian yeast complimented with a lighter touch of hops.  So escape for a while and enjoy this refreshing brewing style.

breweries.name: American Dream Brewing
breweries.description:
American Dream Brewing is a craft brewery coming to Simi Valley soon, offering quality, handcrafted, fresh, brewed beers for both wholesale and retail distribution.  We will have an on-premise tasting room to experience the full flavor taste of our craft brewed beers. We create both traditional beer styles as well as new styles with unique twists.  

American Dream Brewing Company understands the passion that surrounds beer.  We pour that passion into every drop of our beer.  It’s that love to enjoy the best tasting beer that we use the highest quality ingredients.  

We look forward to inviting you to enjoy the American Dream by drinking our beers and celebrating life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness!

breweries.name: Flathead Lake Brewing Company
breweries.description: Flathead Lake Brewing Co. was established in 2004 on the east shore of Flathead Lake in Woods Bay, Montana and is home to handcrafted award winning beers, excellent food and spectacular views. Stop by our world class tasting room for one of our beers and sit back and enjoy the incredible mountain and lake views. It is a Montana experience to remember. Flathead Lake Brewing Co. was established in 2004 with a kitchen added in  March of 2010. FLBC endeavors to provide the highest quality product (all natural, unfiltered, and full of flavor) and customer satisfaction while supporting a responsible beer culture... “Quality Montana Lifestyle, crafted and brewed in the Flathead Valley”. The Brewery features ten premier award winning quality crafted brews as well as seasonal offerings. In addition to our focus on product quality, FLBC creates a positive experience for our customers by offering more than a great brewpub where people can come to relax and converse over great food and beer. It offers a place where people can come to learn more about the beer and the brewing process.

breweries.name: Echo Brewing Company
breweries.description: Echo Brewing Company is a small family run brewery nestled between the towns of Firestone and Frederick in the heart of Colorado’s Carbon Valley.  Founded by twin brothers who have a passion for brewing the best beer possible.  Homebrewers of eight plus years they keep their brewing concept at Echo similar to their homebrewing history: brew one fine beer followed by another while sharing them with the local community.

breweries.name: Davidson Brothers Restaurant & Brewery
breweries.description:
"We’re not real fancy, we believe in great food, exceptional beer and having a good time. Honestly, it’s why we went into business. We’d never owned a restaurant and had no idea how to brew beer, but we were experienced beer tasters and knew plenty about going out to eat.
Granted, this isn’t the salesiest pitch, but we let the food, beer and atmosphere speak for themselves. We stick to the beer guarantee and greeting our guests."
